page.title: 13Farmimg (1) Sheep, Bowness.
page.content: {Sheep}are kept for two purposes,{wool and{mutton.}Three breeds are suited to the fells,{Swaledale,Rough Fell}and{ {Herdwick.}In spring they are rounded up and brought down from the fell. They are fed on{Hay}and{Sheep nuts} until they have had their lambs. In April the male lambs{(wethers)}are separated out and after being fattened on grass are sold for mutton.They are {sheared}in June. The female lambs {(gimmers)}are kept until the age of 18 months for breeding. The sheep are given{medicine,}the lambs{tails}are taken off and they are{wormed.}The lambs are worth about{Â£30,}some are sold for breeding but most for mutton. In autumn the{lambs}are{weaned}from the{ewes}which are dipped and taken to the fell where in November they will be{mated}with the{rams}for the next crop of lambs in spring.
